user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of send_upgrade_required:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
send_upgrade_required (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  struct MHD_Response *res;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  res =
    MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (UPGRADE_REQUIRED_PAGE),
                                            (const void *)
                                            UPGRADE_REQUIRED_PAGE);
  if (MHD_YES !=
      MHD_add_response_header (res, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_SEC_WEBSOCKET_VERSION,
                               WS_SEC_WEBSOCKET_VERSION))
  {
    MHD_destroy_response (res);
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  ret = MHD_queue_response (con, MHD_HTTP_UPGRADE_REQUIRED, res);
  MHD_destroy_response (res);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. The code contains only standard C constructs: a static function definition, enum return type, struct pointers, function calls, an if statement, a cast to (const void *), and macro identifiers (MHD_*, UPGRADE_REQUIRED_PAGE, etc.). None of the following compiler-specific or nonstandard constructs are present: __attribute__ or other compiler attributes, inline assembler (asm), GCC/Clang statement expressions ({ ... }), typeof, nested functions, __extension__, __builtin_* calls, labels-as-values, nonstandard inline semantics, or other documented compiler extensions. The cast (const void *) on the string macro is a standard C cast and the identifier suffix “_static” in the function name is part of the library API, not a language extension. Therefore there are no fragments to report for investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
